title: Margot Robbie and Nicole Kidman co-ordinate their outfits for a second night in a row
text:
They're two of Australia's most glamourous and celebrated exports.

And on Monday night, Margot Robbie, 29, and Nicole Kidman, 52, coordinated their looks for a second night in a row, with the pair both in black at at Elle's Women in Hollywood party at The Four Seasons in Los Angeles.

On Sunday night, the women were both in white at the Bombshell film screening, also in LA.

Mix and match! Margot Robbie and Bombshell co-star Nicole Kidman (both pictured) co-ordinate their outfits for a second night in a row as they attended Elle's Women In Hollywood event on Monday night

The actresses co-star in Bombshell, and appear to have become friendly enough to match up their looks.

On Monday, Margot was dressed to kill in black, in a shimmering black velvet sweater as she arrived at the party, which also featured a black carpet and black backdrop.

The top was tucked into a floor-length black satin skirt with a matching cummerbund.

Stunning: On Monday, Margot was dressed to kill in black, in a shimmering black velvet sweater as she arrived at the party, which also featured a black carpet and black backdrop

Nicole stunned on the black carpet in a blank ankle-length double-breasted tuxedo jacket.

A knee-high leg slit showed off her toned legs in a pair of black lace pointed stilettos with diamond embellishments.

She accessorised with a matching diamond choker, earrings and rings on both hands.

Dark desires: Nicole stunned on the black carpet in a blank ankle-length double-breasted tuxedo jacket

Black was the theme of the event, however the night before both women mutually opted for white.

The night before, at Bombshell film premiere, Nicole classy and elegant in a white pantsuit with striped blouse underneath.

Her Oscar-nominated costar Margot matched in a slightly sexier white linen outfit that was part pantsuit, part beachy bandeau top.
description: They're two of Australia's most glamourous and celebrated exports.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
